comments:
The latest pessimistic provider does not run on JRE 1.3, it seems to have been 
built with a 1.4 compiler and is no longer compatible with a 1.3 runtime.
Hrm... I don't see any problems.  Can you elaborate?  Any walkbacks? etc?

I see a dialog titled 'Error' that states "An error has occured activating 
decorator Pessimistic Filesystem Provider Decorator." I tried running under the 
1.4 JRE and did not receive this problem. The .log contains:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 2 Sep 30, 2002 13:32:37.866
!MESSAGE Problems occurred when invoking code from plug-in: "org.eclipse.ui".
!STACK 0
java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: 
org/eclipse/team/examples/pessimistic/PessimisticFilesystemProviderPlugin 
(Unsupported major.minor version 48.0)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass0(Native Method)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java(Compiled Code))
	at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(SecureClassLoader.java
(Compiled Code))
	at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java(Compiled 
Code))
	at java.net.URLClassLoader$ClassFinder.run(URLClassLoader.java(Compiled 
Code))
...

The JRE that I used when I saw the problem was an IBM 1.3.1 JRE. The same one 
that WSAD v5ea ships with. The JRE that did not have the problem was a Sun 1.4 
JRE.

I haven't been able to reproduce this problem, however I have seen other
problems similar to this, and the solution is always to compile with a 1.3.1 jdk.

Recompiled with 1.3.1.  Although I was unable to reproduce the problem, this has
been generally accepted as the fix.
